frontmatter.title: What can feedback do?

points.point:
Writers who engage with feedback can have a better understanding of audience because they understand that, through writing, they are entering into a conversation with their readers.

:::md-component ExpandableBlockquote previewText="My%20project%20ended%20up%20being%20way%20in%20a%20completely%20different%20mode%20%u2026%20" fullText="%5BMy%20project%20ended%20up%20being%20way%20in%20a%20completely%20different%20mode%20and%20displayed%20way%20differently%20because%20a%20girl%20that%20was%20like%u2014she%20plays%20the%20bass%2C%20she%u2019s%20in%20the%20music%20school%u2014she%u2019s%20like%2C%20%u2018Oh%2C%20I%u2019ve%20done%20this%20before%20and%20you%20should%20try%20this.%u2019%20It%20was%20very%20kind%20of%20push%20and%20shove%20kind%20of%20revision.%20I%20think%20my%20writing%20and%20me%20intellectually%20as%20a%20whole%20I%20think%20was%20pushed%20forward%20because%20of%20the%20people%20and%20the%20different%20array%20of%20measures%20and%20backgrounds%20I%20guess.That%20was%20really%20cool.%5D%28https%3A//hdl.handle.net/2027/fulcrum.10079890/poi.9%29"
points.title: What can feedback do for us?

points.point: Receiving feedback provides a way to reflect on the strengths and weaknesses of our writing. Giving feedback likewise allows good writers to consider different approaches and perspectives about writing.
points.title: Can feedback (really) make better writers?

points.point:
Getting feedback from different perspectives can help us write for different audiences.

:::md-component ExpandableBlockquote previewText="I%20don%u2019t%20think%20in%20any%20of%20my%20classes%20I%20really%20had%20any%20collaborative%20projects%2C%20%u2026" fullText="%5BI%20don%u2019t%20think%20in%20any%20of%20my%20classes%20I%20really%20had%20any%20collaborative%20projects%2C%20but%20peer%20reviews%20have%20been%20so%20extremely%20helpful.%20You%20get%20a%20lot%20from%20your%20professor%20%u2018cause%20obviously%20they%u2019re%20professional%20teachers%20in%20writing%20and%20stuff%2C%20but%20there%u2019s%20nothing%20quite%20like%20the%20feedback%20that%20people%20who%20are%20in%20the%20same%20situation%20as%20you%20have.%20%5C%5BPeer%20review%5D%20was%20insanely%20valuable%20for%20learning%20how%20to%20frame%20it%20ways%20that%20we%20as%20students%20wanted%20to%20frame%20it.%5D%28https%3A//umich.app.box.com/file/294317195119%29"
points.title: One consideration for feedback

points.point:
Consider what feedback can offer. Experts (such as teachers) or **audience members** (such as classmates or colleagues) can help writers see their work differently.

:::md-component ExpandableBlockquote previewText="When%20I%20came%20here%20freshman%20year%2C%20I%20would%20frequently%20receive%20feedback%20in%20my%20classes%20that%20my%20papers%20needed%20to%20be%20more%20specific%20%u2026" fullText="%5BWhen%20I%20came%20here%20freshman%20year%2C%20I%20would%20frequently%20receive%20feedback%20in%20my%20classes%20that%20my%20papers%20needed%20to%20be%20more%20specific.%20Many%20times%20my%20%5C%5Binstructors%5D%20would%20circle%20a%20sentence%20and%20mark%20in%20the%20margin%2C%20%u2018this%20could%20be%20its%20own%20paragraph%2C%u2019%20or%20%u2018develop%20this%20idea%2C%20what%20do%20you%20mean%3F%u2019%20I%20was%20taking%20complex%20arguments%20or%20ideas%20and%20not%20giving%20them%20the%20amount%20of%20space%20they%20deserved%20to%20be%20explained%20fully.%u2026%20It%20took%20practice%20and%20a%20lot%20of%20red%20writing%20in%20the%20margins%2C%20but%20I%20started%20to%20get%20a%20hang%20of%20this%20specificity%20in%20my%20academic%20writing.%5D%28https%3A//umich.box.com/s/13i06nnjyjgzqfsp7ykdo9vtdmtdqpwz%29"
points.title: So, how to make feedback work?

points.point:
Peer review can help us improve as writers because receiving suggestions from others as well as reading and responding to what others have written can improve the ability to see problems in one’s writing.

Check out Sidney’s perspective on peer review:

:::md-component ExpandableBlockquote previewText="Okay.%20Yeah%2C%20so%20the%20class%20was%20structured%20that%20you%20wrote%20three%20eight%20to%20ten%20page%20personal%20essays%20throughout%20the%20semester%20%u2026" fullText="Okay.%20Yeah%2C%20so%20the%20class%20was%20structured%20that%20you%20wrote%20three%20eight%20to%20ten%20page%20personal%20essays%20throughout%20the%20semester%2C%20and%20you%20got%20workshopped%20once%20for%20one%20of%20those%20three%20essays.%20It%20was%20a%20lot%20of%20personal%20writing%2C%20but%20it%20was%20also%20a%20lot%20of%20reading%2C%20peer%20editing%2C%20and%20coming%20in%20and%20workshopping.%20I%20really%20enjoyed%20that%20class%20for%20that%20reason.%20People%u2014the%20first%20week%2C%20no%20one%20was%20really%20sure.%20%u2018Oh%2C%20what%20are%20we%20gonna%20write%20about%2C%u2019%20but%20people%20started%20to%20write%20about%20really%20real%20things.%20It%20was%20a%20very%2C%20very%20interesting%20class%20to%20be%20in%2C%20and%20it%20made%20me%20respect%20a%20lot%20of%20people%20that%20I%20didn%u2019t%20know%20to%20hear%20about%20what%20they%20were%20going%20through%20and%20what%20they%20were%20writing%20about.%20I%20think%20%5C%5Binstructor%5D%20did%20a%20really%20good%20job%20of%20creating%20a%20space%20where%20we%20could%20all%20talk%20about%20things%20like%20that.%20I%20think%20he%20did%20a%20good%20job%20structuring%20the%20peer%20editing%20sessions%20where%20they%20were%20constructive%20and%20they%20weren%u2019t%20everyone%20was%20saying%2C%20%u2018Oh%2C%20great%20job.%u2019%20You%20got%20honest%20feedback%2C%20but%20it%20was%20a%20safe%20space%20where%20people%20were%20also%20telling%20you%20what%20they%20liked%2C%20and%20you%20felt%20okay%20bringing%20big%20ideas%20to%20the%20table%u2026.I%20think%20I%20learned%20a%20lot%2C%20like%20I%20said%2C%20from%20having%20to%20write%20those%20there%20essays%20and%20realizing%20that%20people%20didn%u2019t%20know%20me%20as%20well%20as%20people%20from%20home%20did%2C%20so%20I%20had%20to%20be%20more%20specific%20about%20my%20background%20for%20my%20personal%20pieces%20to%20make%20sense.%20Then%2C%20also%2C%20I%20learned%20a%20lot%20from%20reading%20other%20people%u2019s%20pieces%20and%20the%20styles%20and%20the%20choices%20that%20they%20made%2C%20so%20it%20was%20a%20great%20class.%20I%20really%20liked%20it.%20Probably%20one%20of%20my%20favorites%20at%20U%20of%20M."
points.title: What about peer review?

frontmatter.afterPoints: Writers can improve through feedback by considering what they can learn from it. Trusting others with writing is not easy, but it can provide useful perspectives and insights.
